items.title: Regularly $700 Samsung 27-inch QHD 240Hz Odyssey curved gaming monitor is 57% off today at $300 (2025 low)
items.summary:
As part of its wider sale on Samsung monitors, Woot is offering the brand’s Odyssey G65B 27-inch QHD 240Hz model for $299.99 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). That’s a straight-up 57% discount on a display that regularly goes for $700. Today’s deal knocks $400 off the regular price at Amazon, dropping it down to the lowest price we have tracked for it this year. Only once before today have we seen this 27-inch variant go for less, and it’s now within $70 of that price. The 32-inch variant of this monitor is also down to $359.99 Prime shipped, which is within $10 of its all-time low price. Head below for more details.

items.title: Organize and expand your tool collection with this all-metal organizer at $80 (Reg. $100)
items.summary:
POKIPO 4-Tier All-Metal Tool Storage Organizer

Buy for $80 (Reg. $100)

What we love

If you keep tools in your garage or workshop, you might as well take some time and organize everything. This wall-mountable unit won’t break the bank and will likely hold everything you’ve got and leave you with some room to grow.

items.title: Trump credits Benioff, Huang for decision not to ‘surge’ Fed troops into San Francisco
items.summary: Trump said he scrapped plans to send the National Guard into San Francisco after calls from Nvidia’s Jensen Huang and Salesforce’s Marc Benioff. Mayor Daniel Lurie confirmed the plan was canceled.

items.title: Get a premium clean with the latest and upgraded roborock Qrevo CurvX robot vac + mop at $950 (Reg. up to $1,500)
items.summary:
Right alongside the second-ever low price we spotted on its M7 Q5+ robot, the official roborock Amazon storefront is also now offering the Qrevo CurvX Robot Vacuum and Mop at $949.99 shipped. While normally carrying a $1,500 MSRP directly from the brand, we’ve been seeing this newer generation of the Curv robot keeping between $1,000 and $1,100 since late September, with the Prime Day event two weeks ago giving us a one-time drop to the $900 low. If you missed that price, today’s deal comes in as the next-best rate we have tracked, cutting $150 off the going rate and a total $550 off the MSRP.

more…

items.title: You can get three months of Audible’s subscription for $3
items.summary: If you’re too tight on time to read through your backlog of books, audiobooks might be a more convenient way to get caught up. Amazon is offering a steep discount on Audible Premium Plus that lets new and lapsed subscribers pay $.99 (usually $14.95) per month for three months. The subscription includes one credit per […]

items.title: Dinosaurs may have flourished right up to when the asteroid hit
items.summary: Fossil beds in New Mexico show diverse species present in the late Cretaceous.

items.title: OpenAI buys Sky, an AI interface for Mac
items.summary: OpenAI has acquired Software Applications, Inc., the startup behind Sky — an AI-powered natural language interface for Mac that can view your screen and take actions in your apps.

items.title: Google is turning on the gas for its data centers
items.summary: Google’s latest pledge to support a new clean energy technology is… a gas project? To be precise, it’s a gas-fired power plant outfitted with filtering devices to capture its planet-heating carbon emissions. Is this just a polluting fossil fuel project in sheep’s clothing?  Google just inked an agreement to support the development of a new […]

items.title: Supercharge a power outlet with this 15-in-1 USB-C extender, now $12 (Save 29%)
items.summary:
Addtam 15-in-1 USB-C Outlet Extender

Buy for $12 (Reg. $17)

What we love

For most folks, this will arguably be overkill, but isn’t that sort of the point? This handy extender turns a single outlet into 15 power sources that include 12 AC, two USB-A, and one Type-C. An included screw holds it tight against the outlet for a sturdy feel.

more…

items.title: Rivian CEO takes top marketing role in shakeup ahead of R2 launch
items.summary: Founder and CEO RJ Scaringe will be wearing yet another hat as the company preps for arguably its most important vehicle launch -- the mass market R2 SUV -- in 2026.

items.title: Sony now offering massive $900 price drops on some of its most popular Alpha series mirrorless cameras
items.summary:
We don’t feature a ton of proper mirrorless and DSLR camera deals around here – they are, after all a bit of a niche or acquired taste for some these days. But Sony has some of its most popular models seeing some gigantic price drops this week at up to $900 off the list prices, including the Alpha 7R V and Alpha 7 IV, for folks looking to get in on the action or upgrade to a hardcore solution. 

more…

items.title: EA partners with Stability AI for ‘transformative’ AI game-making tools
items.summary: EA is partnering with Stability AI, the company that develops the Stable Diffusion AI image model, to help infuse AI into its development processes. The two companies will “co-develop transformative AI models, tools, and workflows that empower our artists, designers, and developers to reimagine how content is built,” EA says. The company says that humans […]

items.title: The best AirPods to buy
items.summary: Whether you’re buying your first pair of AirPods or replacing a well-used older pair, it’s easy to understand why so many iPhone owners prefer Apple’s earbuds and headphones over other options. Apple has spent years gradually adding new features that work best — and sometimes only work at all — with the company’s own devices. […]

items.title: Make up to 4 cables disappear with this cord cover kit, now $11.50 (Save 32%)
items.summary:
Delamu 142-inch 4-Cord Cover Kit

Buy for $11.50 (Reg. $17)

What we love

Delamu has slowly transformed into my go-to brand for cord cover. In fact, this past weekend I used some to tidy up cables in my own home. This particular kit offers more than 11 feet of coverage for up to 4 cords.

items.title: An NIH director joins MAHA, gets replaced by JD Vance’s close friend
items.summary: The NTP produced controversial studies on cellphone radiation and fluoride.

items.title: Anker’s PowerCore Reserve station packs a 192Wh battery into a 5-pound unit for $80 (Reg. up to $150)
items.summary:
Amazon is offering the Anker PowerCore Reserve 60,000mAh Power Station for $79.98 shipped. It may carry a $150 MSRP directly from the brand, but you’re more likely to find it going for $110 most of the time, while some discounts have taken things lower to $90, $80, and a one-time $75 low we saw in July. During the Prime Day event two weeks ago, we saw this same rate pop up, with you getting another chance today, cutting a total $70 off the MSRP for the second-best price we have tracked.

more…

items.title: Grab seven pairs of bamboo underwear that’s ‘30% more breathable than cotton’ from $5.50 each
items.summary:
BAMBOO COOL Ultra Breathable Underwear (7-pack)

Buy for $39.50 (Reg. $60)

What we love

This brand goes all-in on bamboo with underwear that’s made with 92% viscose. This move is said to make the material “30% more breathable than cotton.” The brand also touts that it reduces body temperature by an average of “3 degrees.”

items.title: YouTube paid out $8B to the music industry in 12 months
items.summary: The milestone marks a new record for the platform, as YouTube’s annual music industry payout increased by $2 billion since 2022.

items.title: Apple’s 4-pack of AirTags back at Prime Day price on Amazon ($16 each)
items.summary:
I guess everybody already has an AirTag laying around somewhere by now, but if you’re looking to expand your Apple tracking arsenal, Amazon’s Prime Day price is back. The single listing has jumped up $5 since then, and the 4-pack option has now dropped back down to $64.99 shipped to deliver an even better per tag price. 

more…

items.title: 20-year-old dropouts built AI notetaker Turbo AI to 5 million users
items.summary: Rudy Arora and Sarthak Dhawan, two 20-year-old college dropouts, grew an AI note-taker app to five million users and an eight-figure ARR, they say.

items.title: Instagram users can now use Meta AI editing tools directly in IG Stories
items.summary: Meta AI's photo editing tools can be found in Instagram Stories when tapping the paintbrush icon. Users can describe what they want to add, remove, or change.

items.title: Slice open packages with this incredibly slim pocket knife that’s now under $8 (Save 21%)
items.summary:
FUNBRO Slim Pocket Knife

Buy for $8 (Reg. $10)

What we love

A lot of pocket knives out there are much wider than this. To my eye, this looks roughly the size of a pen, and could even be clipped on the inside of a pocket for a similar look. With this compact solution at your side, you’ll be ready to open packages and the like with less effort required.

items.summary: "Mico" literally tries to put a face on Microsoft's chatbot-turned-assistant.

We have some early promotional offers on the new Android XR headset if you’re looking to “play” them on a set of Galaxy goggles, just be sure to also scope out the deals we have right now on the Xbox gaming handhelds, up to $185 in savings on the Bose QuietComfort Ultra ANC headphones, and Pixel 9 drops back at $254 off. items.title: I’ve been using this 10-foot 8-in-1 USB-C surge protector for months, grab one at $13 (Reg. $20)
items.summary:
Addtam 8-in-1 10-foot USB-C Surge Protector

Buy for $13 (Reg. $20)

What we love

I’ve actually been using this surge protector to power a part of my office since July. It’s been a trooper and I love that it has not only four AC outlets, but also two USB-A and two Type-C ports. A lengthy 10-foot cable makes it easy to get power from one end of a room to the other too.

items.title: Introducing Build Mode: TechCrunch’s new podcast for founders
items.summary: Build Mode is our new podcast that will be a survival guide for early-stage founders navigating the messy, high-stakes chaos of building a company from scratch, hosted by Startup Battlefield Editor Isabelle Johannessen.

items.title: Ghana's former First Lady Nana Konadu Rawlings dies aged 76
items.summary: She was married to Ghana's longest-serving leader Jerry John Rawlings and known for her women's rights work.

items.title: San Francisco Mayor Daniel Lurie is coming to TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
items.summary: San Francisco Mayor Daniel Lurie steps onto the Disrupt Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, October 27-29 at Moscone West, in a homecoming of sorts for both tech and the city that helped define it.

If your office is feeling a bit drab and your exisiting desk chair has seen better days, you’re in luck. FlexiSpot’s vibrant ergonomic chair is currently priced at $100, which is a reasonable price for a model like this, let alone one that has a stylish design.

items.summary: Copilot Mode of Microsoft's Edge browser is the company's take on the long-hyped AI browser category.

items.title: Rosenberg: Trump abandons carrot and wields stick over Putin in Ukraine talks
items.summary: The BBC's Russia editor says Trump's decision to call off his Putin talks and impose oil sanctions will not go down well in Moscow.

items.title: Don’t like cramped MagSafe wallets? This bifold with Apple Find My holds 9 cards + 15 bills for just $29 (42% off)
items.summary:
Courtesy of ESR’s official Amazon storefront, you can now score the brand’s ESR Geo Wallet with Find My in black for $28.79 with free shipping for Prime members or in orders over $35. Don’t forget to enter promo code EJ3NIM43 during checkout to see the discounted price. After debuting on Kickstarter last year at $38, this model later arrived on Amazon with a $50 list price. It has previously dropped to $36, but today’s 42% discount takes another $7 off to mark a new all-time low. This is the best price we’ve tracked yet for this bi-fold wallet, so be sure to snag it after getting more details below.

more…

items.title: Microsoft’s Mico is a ‘Clippy’ for the AI era
items.summary: Microsoft has unveiled “Mico,” a new animated avatar for its Copilot AI that brings back shades of Clippy. The expressive blob acts as a friendly, customizable face for the chatbot.

items.title: The first people to set foot in Australia were fossil hunters
items.summary: Europeans weren't the first people to collect fossils in Australia.

items.title: Trump pardons Binance founder Changpeng Zhao
items.summary: Changpeng Zhao previously pleaded guilty to enabling money laundering while running the cryptocurrency exchange, and served four months in prison last year.

items.title: CS2 item market loses nearly $2B in value overnight due to “trade up” update
items.summary: Once rare $14K knife now sells for $7K, some common guns jump from $10 to over $100.

items.title: Great hybrid V6, lousy HMI: Three days with a Ferrari 296 GTB
items.summary: Three days with a car revealed its character in more ways than one.

items.title: Google’s bets on carbon capture power plants, which have a mixed record
items.summary: Google intends to use electricity from the 400-MW power plant in Decatur, Illinois, to operate nearby data centers. Carbon capture will eliminate some of the plant's emissions, but how much remains to be seen.

items.title: Tensormesh raises $4.5M to squeeze more inference out of AI server loads
items.summary: Tensormesh uses an expanded form of KV caching to make inference loads as much as 10 times more efficient.

items.title: US accuses former L3Harris cyber boss of stealing and selling secrets to Russian buyer
items.summary: The U.S. Department of Justice accused Peter Williams, former general manager of L3Harris’ hacking division Trenchant, of stealing trade secrets and selling them to a buyer in Russia.

items.title: Trump eyes government control of quantum computing firms with Intel-like deals
items.summary: Some quantum computing firms seem optimistic about Trump's proposed deals.

items.title: Made in space: Varda’s William Bruey shares plan to build the next great supply chain at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
items.summary: William Bruey, founder and CEO of Varda Space Industries, is taking the Space Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, October 27–29 at Moscone West in San Francisco, to share how his team is transforming outer space into the ultimate manufacturing frontier. Register here to save up to $444 before doors open.

items.title: Palantir enters $200M partnership with telco Lumen to offer enterprise AI services
items.summary: Palantir said on Thursday it had struck a partnership with Lumen Technologies that will see the telecommunications company using the data management company's AI software to build capabilities to support enterprise AI services.

items.title: Sora update to bring AI videos of your pets, new social features, and soon, an Android version
items.summary: OpenAI’s hit AI video app, Sora, is getting a wave of new features, including video editing tools, pet and object “cameos,” and enhanced social options. The Android app is also “coming soon."

items.title: Reports suggest Apple is already pulling back on the iPhone Air
items.summary: New phone design compromises on camera and battery to achieve a lighter weight.

items.title: An outcast faces a deadly alien world in Predator: Badlands trailer
items.summary: "The ways of your kind are ones of violence. Either you are hunted or you become the hunter."

items.title: Porsche does U-turn on electric vehicles, will focus on gas engines
items.summary: China weakness, US tariffs, and disappointing uptake of battery vehicles lurk in background.

items.title: New images show Israeli control line deeper into Gaza than expected
items.summary: Israel has placed boundary markers up to 520m deeper inside Gaza than expected under the ceasefire deal with Hamas.

items.title: China names new second highest-ranking general after military purge
items.summary: Zhang Shengmin heads anti-corruption efforts in the army and is seen as a trusted loyalist of President Xi.

items.title: France backing away from pledge to intercept migrant boats, sources tell BBC
items.summary: The commitment has been hit by delays, with political turmoil in France partly to blame.
